previous: Aga Khan IV, the Spiritual Leader of the Ismaili Muslims, expressed his "shock and sadness" and said that it represented a "senseless act of violence against a peaceful community".[34]

Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, Chief Minister of Sindh Qaim Ali Shah and leaders of major political parties strongly condemned the shooting.[2] The Prime Minister declared the following day a national day of mourning during which the flag will fly at half-mast.[29] Chief of Army Staff General Raheel Sharif canceled his three day visit to Sri Lanka and went to Karachi to assess the situation.[30] General Sharif also telephoned Prince Aga Khan, leader of the Ismaili community, during which he expressed his condolences, stating: "Our heart goes out for the bereaved families. No efforts will be spared to apprehend and punish the perpetrators of this terrorist act and their abettors."[31] The attack was also condemned by other notable public figures.[32][33]
